title: Punctuation Quiz
description: Rules and proper usage of punctuation marks

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a semicolon (;)?
options: To link two closely related independent clauses

questions.question: Which sentence uses an apostrophe correctly?
options: The children's toys were scattered about.
The Smith's are coming to dinner.

questions.question: What is an Oxford comma?
options: A comma used after a greeting
A comma placed before the conjunction in a list of three or more items
A comma used in British English only
A comma placed after every word

questions.question: When should you use a colon (:)?
options: To introduce a list, explanation, or elaboration after an independent clause

questions.question: What does an ellipsis (...) typically indicate in writing?
options: An omission of words, a trailing off, or a pause
The start of a new paragraph

questions.question: Which mark is used to show a sudden break or interruption in thought?
In American English, where do commas and periods go in relation to closing quotation marks?
What is the difference between a hyphen (-) and an en dash (–)?
options: A hyphen joins words; an en dash indicates a range
A hyphen is longer than an en dash
An en dash joins words; a hyphen indicates a range

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a question mark?
options: She asked if I was coming?
I wonder whether it will rain?
Could you please pass the salt?

questions.question: What are parentheses ( ) primarily used for?
options: To enclose additional or supplementary information

questions.question: Which is the correct use of 'its' vs. 'it's'?
options: Its means 'it is'; it's shows possession
It's means 'it is'; its shows possession

questions.question: What punctuation mark is also called an 'exclamation point'?
Square brackets [ ] are most commonly used in writing to:
options: Add editorial comments or clarifications within quotations

questions.question: Which sentence uses commas correctly around a nonessential clause?
options: My brother who lives in Texas is visiting.
My brother, who lives in Texas, is visiting.
My brother who lives in Texas, is visiting.
My, brother who lives in Texas is visiting.
